newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh orders probe into deadly train accident.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh orders probe into deadly train accident.

text.p: Bangladesh has ordered an official enquiry into Saturday's train accident near Dhaka that killed at least seven people and injured more than 100 others, railway officials said.
"A high-level investigation commitee with senior officials has been formed to probe the accident, a railway official said on Sunday.
The committee will report within five days, he said.
Sunday newspapers reported nine casualties in the accident. But the official said only seven deaths had been confirmed.
The cause of the accident was not immediately known.
Five coaches of the Mahanagar Express jumped the tracks and plunged into a ditch at Khilkhet on the northern outskirts of Dhaka around 1 p.m. (0700 GMT) on Saturday.
The train runs runs between Dhaka and Chittagong port city.
Officials said the partially-submerged coaches were lifted back on track with the help of cranes on Saturday night.
"I was surprised to see fewer bodies inside the coaches. We earlier thought several had been trapped in the wreckage," one official said.
He said many people could have leapt from the train which had been slowing as it neared the station.
